data.title: Funky Event Space, Incredible Staff
data.text:
I run an event planning business and recently did a wedding at the Crofoot. I was impressed from start to finish. 
Prior to the event, I met with the Crofoot's coordinator, Kristine. Both myself and the couple were blown away by her knowledge, the care she took and the wonderful suggestions she made to make the night perfect. 
During setup, the staff was friendly and accommodating. My business partner couldn't believe how clean the venue was and the pride the staff took in their work. 
I would highly recommend this versatile space for your event needs, I thought the value, service and ease of use make this a top notch event venue!

data.text: Nice club. Good sound system. Clean. Secure. Can't wait until next summer when  SOR returns on there summer tour!!

data.title: Intimate and Fun Venue -
data.text:
We've visited the Crofoot twice, most recently to see Caravan Palace on June 20.

The Crofoot is one of a number of clubs that now basically make up downtown Pontiac.  We waited outside before doors opened among a friendly crowd.

They have different bands just about every night, so you'll want to look ahead.  They have everything from international groups (Caravan Palace, the Buzzcocks) to local bands.

Inside, it's a simple but intimate venue.  We had the sense that someone had taken pride both in restoring whatever the original venue was and also maintaining it to a high standard.  The sound system was excellent. Bathrooms were clean and modern.

We stood towards the front, but there was also what appeared to be excellent room in the balcony, which runs along the side.  The crowds both nights we came here were just there to enjoy themselves - everyone seemed to respect everyone else and to have a good time.

The staff was professional and pleasant.  We were able to get Bell's Two-Hearted Ale in bottles, so we were pretty happy, but there were many other kinds of beer and other drinks available.

One note:  Pontiac is more or less in transition.  It felt very safe due to the crowds and wide spaces (as well as the presence of security), but, politely, you might want to make sure your valuables are locked securely in the trunk or don't bring them at all.  There is parking across the street.  You need to pay $5 into a machine to park (actually, it gives you until 6:00 a.m. the next morning).  Apparently they will tow your car although the night we were there they just asked to see your receipt upon exit (we saw $5 change hands a lot).

Crofoot was perfect for an act like Caravan Palace - basically the whole place was dancing and jumping with the music and the energy level was about as high as it gets.

The Crofoot is a good place to enjoy original acts in a venue where you are no more than maybe 50 feet from the stage.

data.title: Welcoming and comfortable
data.text: Have been to the Crofoot many times over the past several years and always enjoy coming here. Has a huge parkinglot for shows just across the street. Has several bars for convenience located upstairs and downstairs. Has plenty of room for pit area and higher levels to watch show. Love it can't wait to go back.
For the economy to be the way it is. This place is very pricy  to book for a party. And the drink/Bar deals are not a deal. Way to over priced. Even the small banquet  rooms are exspensive.

data.title: Way nicer than I expected for a concert
data.text: I enjoyed this small feeling venue (ballroom).  It was clean and comfortable feeling.  Low cost parking across the street.  There was no food available at the venue, but plenty of beverage options, with a coat check.  I am always leery when taking my tween to a new venue for a rock show, but there was plenty of security (with no need for them that I saw, other than to catch crowd surfers).  This venue is definitely a multi use venue.  It looks nice enough for formal events, but cozy enough for a more intimate feeling concert.   I did not view the other rooms at the venue.

data.title: Went to see Wilson perform!
data.text: The Crofoot Ballroom is a great small concert venue. The bottle beer was $5.50 each. There were no chairs for the concert. A few stools at the bars. There is an upstairs area that was closed off. There's an outdoor area for smokers. The bathrooms are behind an unmarked door by the entrance. It was $15 per person for the show. The place looks pretty clean for a concert venue. Wilson rocked it!

data.title: Great Venue for an AMAZING Concert!
data.text: We attended the Meet & Greet and Concert for the band Machine Head at the Crofoot.  We loved the venue and cannot say enough about what a great place it is to see a show!  We were in the front row and the Security staff were top notch.  They watched out for my boys and I and let us know when crowd surfers were coming so we could duck and not get injured.  One gave me a spare set of ear plugs (I had forgotten mine) AND he gave us a few ice cold bottles of water half way through the set because it was so warm in there.  The acoustics were fantastic and everyone seemed to have a great view of the band.  Would definitely come back to see another show here!  Oh and the coatcheck girl was super friendly and helpful too! :)

data.title: Nick Jonas
data.text:
This was my first time at The CroFoot, and I have to say I fell in love with the venue.
My dad and I were there to see Nick Jonas and It was so nice.
The sound in the ballroom blew me away, it was wonderful.
We traveled from Ohio, but it was so worth it.
Until next time

data.title: Great little concert venue.
data.text:
Enjoyed A Great Big World here after it was moved from Royal Oak.  Parking ($5) was a breeze.  Security did a great job of checking IDs and marking minors.  Would have loved stations to just buy bottles of water near the front of the venue.

Arrived about 6:20 to a line of about 30 people outside.  Doors did open at 7 PM as stated.  Three lines taking tickets to get into the venue.  Small rush to get to the front, but nothing unsafe.

Never used (nor found) the bathroom.

data.title: A true gem of a venue.
data.text:
I have attended over a dozen concerts at this location over the past year and a half, and have never been disappointed. Most cost between $10-15 and offered a showcase of genuine talent and artistry. The staff are friendly, there is always toilet paper and clean stalls, and The Pike room stands out as an intimate gathering in which the artists must walk through the crowd to get on and off stage. The interaction is phenomenal and the events start on time more often than comparable venues. Plenty of street parking usually available on top of having a parking lot across the street. 
The Crofoot is a treasure for live music fanatics and ambience junkies alike.

data.title: Great small venue!!!
data.text:
Fun little venue. Clean. Friendly staff. 
Love the brick inside. The smoking area outside is large and has patio furniture. The indoor balcony level was closed during the show I went to but would be so fun when opened!!

data.title: Great, Intimate Venue!
data.text:
Took my daughter and her friend up to Pontiac for a Twenty-One Pilots concert at The Crofoot. We stayed at the Auburn Hills Marriott at Centerpoint (see separate review) which was only 10 minutes away. 

What a great venue! We arrived about a half-hour before doors opened and there was already a line. I picked up our tickets at the will-call and got in line. The Crofoot serves alcohol, and there were security personnel going through the line. Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE, that wanted to drink alcohol had to provide a picture ID  and they would give you a wrist band. The Crofoot is an old converted building in the downtown district. I believe it has several different sized rooms for concerts, but this one was in the largest. For this concert, I would guess there were maybe 500 people in attendance.  It's a two story room with a balcony around the upstairs perimeter. The sound system is phenomenal ("killer")!! There were a couple of bars in this room and another room across the hall with a bar and some TVs. There was NEVER a wait to get a drink. It is a "no smoking" venue but there is an outside patio where smoking is permitted. There was also a coat check.

I've been to a lot of concerts in my life, but I loved this place! It was small enough for my daughter to get up close to the group, but large enough where I didn't feel claustrophobic. And did I mention the killer sound system...? I look forward to returning for another group.

data.title: For the under 30 crowd
data.text: Attended a sold out concert where doors were to open at 8pm for very limited seating.  We got there before 8pm, and apparently, they opened doors much earlier, as there were no seats left, and with TWO HOURS before the opening act, it was a long wait.  There is seating, however,  in little bar areas away from the main stage.  There was standing room only for the concert, people were constantly either TALKING during the whole show, or traversing back and forth to the exit areas.  The sound was rather crummy, especially with all the yammering people.  I don't plan on going back, it was definitely not for me!

data.title: This venue rocks!
data.text:
Went and saw Kasabian here 2 weeks back, and what a show!

Venue is nice. Not too big not too small, good view of the stage from anywhere inside. The bar was great, fast service and reasonable drinks ($5 for a premium beer). No line ups, staff was fast at the door, bathrooms are new. Parking is $4 right across the street. If a band is playing here that you like, you'll have a blast! Lots of people taking pics and video as well during the show if anyone cares. Pontiac itself is pretty blah, but the venues there are awesome!
